runs.comm: back of a length, down the leg side - wide
leg side again, Carberry tries to nudge off his hips and fails to make contact - Rob Bailey gives Kula the benefit this time
pitched up, Carberry gets forward and nudges a couple back down the ground to open his account
lovely delivery, good length and drawing Carberry forward before swooning towards slip, past the outside edge
fuller and wider, Carberry chases this and misses - called this time
width on offer again, frees the arms and carves over backward point, just gets enough of the bat to take it beyond the clutching arm and away for England's first boundary
straighter line, tapped into the leg side for a single
line and length outside off from Kula, steps forward and offers no stroke
pitched up around off stump, punched into the covers

not quite so full, Carberry shuffles forward and slices hiiiiiiiigggghhh to third man... where Kulasekara plunges forward and hangs on! Carberry was trying to take Mathews on, hitting to leg and it left him a touch, no control on the shot
length ball outside the line of off, Hales gently taps it short on the off side
on the front foot, pushes into the covers
touch shorter, angles the bat and picks up a single to extra cover
angled in, Bell walks out to meet a length ball and dabs a single on the leg side
good length, shaping back in at Bell, pokes it back to the bowler
slightly short and wide, Bell seizes on it and cracks a firm cut coming forwards, Dilshan dives to stop
there's the Bell loft, strides out to chip Kula over mid-on, not the cleanest strike but clears the fielder and bobbles away to the rope
advances again, this maybe holds its line a fraction outside off as Bell plays and misses
pushed towards leg stump, Bell shuffling across flicks and fails to connect... given as a wide
half a chance but dropped by Kulasekara, a mistimed plink back towards the bowler, who dived to his right but couldn't grab it a few inches above the turf
on the stumps, works on through square leg - bellows "No!" to cut off any thoughts of a second
goodish length outside off, comes forward and works across the line through midwicket
nicely done by Lakmal, in-between length and beating the bat as Hales pushes forward tentatively
top-edged and it goes all the way, short of a length and Hales swivelled on it, pinged the ball over keeper and slip
slightly short from Lakmal and this is pulled out of the middle, flat, one bounce through deep backward square leg - four more
on the stumps, makes a bit of room and drives a single wide of mid-off
works a length ball into the leg side, wants two but Hales declines this time
around the wicket, angled across outside off, Bell pulls flat down the ground to long-on
slightly wide, skidding on outside off, Hales chops powerfully down on the ball and gets it between point and cover, that will run away
floats this up with a little more air, on middle and off, turned into the leg side
Bell reverses the hands, sweeps across the line to a ball outside leg stump, misses but succeeds in foxing Chandimal and it races away
floated up around off stump, opens up his body and threads a drive through the covers! Regal from Bell
tossed up outside leg stump, Bell shapes to reverse sweep again, lets it go... and then asks why it wasn't called wide
on the money straight up, slower and dipping as Hales tries to close the face, a leading edge falls short of mid-off and they scamper one
on the stumps, comes forward to meet it with a straight bat
edged and dropped at slip! Thirimanne is the man where Mahela would have been standing but his hands aren't as reliable and a thick edge pops straight back out
full and on middle and leg, tries to work to leg, miscues the shot

Bell attacks, skies into the off side... and Kusal slips in the covers before recovering to take the catch! This was a length ball, Malinga cut his fingers over it and Bell mistimed his shot almost perpendicular to the pitch... not the most convincing return in the shortest format for I Ron Man
slightly too full and Hales leans into a crisp drive, pierces the cover field and that will be four
off-stump line, comes forward and pats back towards the bowler
angled in towards middle and leg, chops one through square
rolls his fingers over this ball, takes the pace off and Hales dinks it back wide of Mathews, leading edge but they get one to long-on
Root is sent back after working to midwicket, quick pick up and throw as Root dives for the crease, needed a direct hit
another miscue, this time a top edge looping safely into the leg side beyond midwicket, slower ball again from Mathews, I think
turns one more to leg
length ball, swinging away and Root throws the hands, doesn't connect... given wide, though must have been tight
outside off, drives away from his body and picks up one
straighter line, pushed back coming forwards
aims a meaty blow across the line but doesn't connect properly and the ball plops down on to the pitch in front of the stumps
Lakmal attempts to bowl at the stumps, slides past leg
full toss and this swings late, past Hales malevolent blow and narrowly past off stump as well
full again, clipped off the pads through square for a single

down the leg side, Root gets a tickle on it and Chandimal collects! Lakmal gets a wicket, not one for the hall of fame but they all count... the ball slipped off the face of the bat as he tried to whip through square
length ball on the stumps, takes this through square leg for one
back of a length, drops back and defends in front of the stumps
slightly short, nudged into the leg side from back in the crease to get Morgan into credit
bit of width, slices a single down to third man
takes the pace off and Morgan lollipops a dab to leg just past short midwicket, scrambling to his right

slower ball again, outside off and Hales clubs firmly in front of the man in the deep, Morgan isn't in the picture as the throw comes in but dives to make his ground, Thisara couldn't take it cleanly anyway
starts with a length ball outside off, no tricks and Morgan drives loosely, plays around it... Chandimal appeals but neither Malinga or umpire Michael Gough were that interested
fuller length, maybe slower, worked to midwicket - another dot
slower delivery on the stumps, Morgan drops it on to the cut strip and they steal one
rolls the fingers over this one, it skips down the leg side, beats Chandimal's dive... and that will be four extra wides
on the stumps, changes of pace and Hales gets a leading edge through midwicket
shuffles across and closes the face, works a single to long-on

length ball, there's bat and pad involved as Morgan comes forward in front of the stumps, not sure which was first but Malinga is certain, appealing desperately... Hawk-Eye shows it would have hit but Morgan is still there
full, Morgan gives himself room and slaps down to long-off
back on his stumps and clipped past midwicket for a single
down the track, looks leg side but misses completely and it takes the pad down the leg side
step down the wicket, forced out behind square on the leg side, sloppy work from Malinga and they get back for the second
down the wicket and struck well down the ground, straight as a dye and finds the rope, welcome boundary
Malinga makes up for his earlier sloppiness with a fine diving save at short long leg, certain four from that Hale's pull otherwise
yorker just outside off, Hales digs it out and runs it down to third man, just a single
full and wide, driven but Morgan can't evade backward point

low full toss outside off, Morgan reaches for it and chips it down the ground, long-off runs in and Lakmal takes a superb catch diving forward, that's a cracking catch. Very hard coming at the ball but that was a very smart piece of work, big wicket too
full and wide, carved wide of third man, another welcome four and that's 1000 international T20 runs for Hales
driven again but this is straight to deep cover point
back foot, poked out to deep cover
around the wicket, full on leg stump, clipped out through square leg
touch shorter length, back foot push to deep cover
reverse sweep and nails it through point, excellent timing
back and tries to play down the ground, gets an inside edge up the wicket
this time connects properly and finds long-off
sets back in the crease and aims leg side with a pull but misses completely
push and go from off stump to mid-off, they get home comfortably
yorker length, dug out through square leg, just a single into the deep, 100 up
step to leg and carves a drive over extra-cover but the timing isn't good enough to beat the cover sweeper
nicely-timed drive and beats mid-off who's up in the circle, steered it cleverly into the gap
full on the stumps, a punchy leg side clip and this again is timed wonderfully well and runs past midwicket and beats the man in the deep
similar delivery, a touch fuller, dabbed straight to midwicket this time for just a single but that's a better over for England, plenty more needed
steps across his stumps to go for the scoop, it was a slower ball which Buttler missed and narrowly avoided being bowled
cut very hard and it spins away from the sweeper who overruns it and it goes for four
pulled and smashed, leathered it, but straight to deep midwicket
another slower ball, picked and driven nicely down the ground, great timing, that's four inside long-off, fifty for Hales
slower ball at the stumps, dug out from Hales and they get a single towards square leg
another slower ball, Buttler was down ready and tried to pull, could only steer it to deep square
full at the stumps, tried to be swung hard but only as far as midwicket
full and wide, reached out for and driven to deep cover

full toss on the stumps, right in the slot, Buttler goes leg side but gets it right off the toe and Dilshan takes the catch at deep midwicket. Bad miscue from Buttler and a very bad ball to get out to
sets himself outside off stump and swings handsomely down the ground over long-off, great strike
goes again, this is a miscue to the off side but it lands short of the sweeper
low full toss outside off, steered to point, only a single but Hales keeps the strike
slower ball, Hales misses aiming leg side, it bounces off the keeper on the bounce and runs to the off side for a bye
length just outside off, steered calmly down to third man
72mph back of a length, Hales waits for it and slaps it through cow corner, firm hit, finds the rope

another slower ball, this 73mph, and Hales swings leg side and misses. Malinga holds his nerve, four slower balls in a row and Hales eventually succumbs. The last went for four, expecting full pace, Hales set himself to go leg side but it was pace off again and did for Hales
another slower ball, it dips on Jordan right back on the stumps, huge appeal for lbw but it was outside edge and it runs away to fine third man, nearly done like a treat their Jordan
another slower ball and this slips past the outside edge and through to the keeper, six slower balls but it did go for 10 so okay for England
nails the wide yorker, just inside the guideline and Bopara misses
full, struck hard off side, can't evade the cover sweeper running to his right
right on the line again outside off, Bopara swings and misses, this is called wide but that was just inside the guidelines, harsh call
wonderful shot, Bopara leans back and lifts a full ball up and over extra-cover, great timing
tucked to extra-cover, Malinga fumbles and Jordan charges back for an outrageous second, great running
yorker-length again just outside off and Bopara is beaten aiming off side
steps across the off stump and whips a low full toss leg side and finds the cow corner rope, picked his gap and creamed it
73mph on the stumps, blocked into the covers and they take a quick single
excellent yorker, 85mph, right on the money, nothing Bopara can do except dab it to point

another slower ball, Jordan tries to step back and play off side but is through too early on the stroke and gets a thick inside edge into his stumps. Jordan without too much of an idea against Malinga, he's finally decided to force the pace and has perished
yet again, it's pace off the ball, clipped into the leg side and they get a single
Bopara down to scoop, it was full pace and outside off, nowhere to go for Bopara and he missed completely
low full toss, played to extra-cover and that is an absolutely outstanding over from Malinga, probably a match-winning over
full at the stumps, Bopara across his stumps swinging leg side misses and got an inside edge which saved the lbw
yorker-length, swung down the ground, easy two to long-on
length ball at the pads, swung leg side and Bopara clears the rope, big strike
leg side again, met on the full and gets four past long leg, it was a ball to go large with but Bopara go it all along the floor, still alive though England
full outside off but Bopara can only run it down to long-off for a single
full at the pads, Woakes can only dab it to midwicket for a single
